article.headline: Centenary 82, Louisiana Tech 73
article.story: BOSSIER CITY, La. (AP) -- Tyrone Hamilton scored 27 points and Bryan Baumann added 18 as Centenary defeated Louisiana Tech 82-73 on Thursday in a game held in the neutral CenturyTel Center. By the 15-minute mark of the first half, Centenary (5-7) had built a 15-8 lead, but a 3-pointer by Tech's Marcus Elliot cut it to 15-11. Louisiana Tech then went on an 11-4 run, capped off by a pair of free throws from Kyle Gibson, to tie the game at 22-22. However, on the ensuing possession, Centenary's Bryan Baumann returned the lead to the Gents with his fourth 3-pointer of the first half. The Gents outscored the Bulldogs 14-8 for the rest of the half and took a 36-30 lead into the locker room. The Bulldogs (2-8) kept the game close in the second half, finally taking the lead at the 11:22 mark with a 3-pointer from Trey McDowell to put the score at 54-52. Centenary, however, rallied with 7:42 to go on a 3-point shot from Hamilton that made it 61-60 and then the Gents ran off eight unanswered points that helped seal the win. Chad McKenzie and McDowell each had 19 points to lead Tech. Alexander Starr added 14 points for Centenary.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
